_header: Man have this in thy mind
Subjects: evils of the age; marriage, advice on
_description: Advice on marriage — one monorhyming quatrain

BodEngPoete1.Transcription:
Man haue þis in þi myndþat þou doost with thyn
                    hond þat shalt þou fyndWyves be rekeles chyldren be on
                    kyndExcetutors be covet[ ]old þat þei fynd
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 35.
Masters,  James Edwin,
                        ed.  
             Rymes of the Minstrels.
         Shaftesbury, Dorset: High House Press, 1927; anonymous: 17.

BLHar2316.Transcription: Man of þe self þu haf god myndeþat þu dost wiht þi hand þat schaltu findenhilder ben foryetele and wiues ben vnkyndeþat þat comed in þe seccures hendes often it is bi hynden
BLHar2316.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas. 
             A selection of Latin stories.
Percy Society
         8. London: Richard, 1842: 83.

GULHun230.Transcription:
Man on the molde haue this in myndethat thowe Soyth here þat
                    sall thou fyndWemen ben laches and chyldryn on kyndsecturs cum aftur
                    and Tak qwat they fynd
GULHun230.Note: Added to end flyleaf by sixteenth-century hand; included in 2728.
